title: Missing emails
creator: 2kv58dpcmn
content: I installed recently Thunderbird on my Apple computer. I compared the mails received from Thunderbird with the emails received from the web version of Outlook. I noticed that at least 3 emails, that I received with the web version of outlook, were never received by Thunderbird.

title: Thunderbird refuses coloured text on Lenovo Idealpad and adds astérisques not written
creator: andrewjholford
content: Thunderbird refuses colored text on new Lenovo 17" Idealpad and adds asterisks not written by the author. Example message test: bbbbbbbbbbbbsssssssss ggggggggggggg***234*5678,56 *<==============* The written numbers and the arrow were colored red. No asterisks were written in the message sent. When writing, colors appeared correctly in messages with no asterisks on screen. However, no colors appear and asterisks are added in recorded messages sent and received on the PC. The Lenovo PC works OK in general, so it must be a Thunderbird configuration/function problem on my PC as the message is correctly received with colors without asterisks on my mobile phone. Can you help me correct this PC anomaly? Many thanks
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Windows 11 sur Lenovo 17" Idealpad PC

title: How can I safely back up all my emails from Zimbra Desktop without losing any data?
creator: rahul.pcvita01
content:
Backing up Zimbra Desktop manually involves exporting your emails, contacts, and calendars using the built-in export feature, but this can be time-consuming and prone to errors, especially for large mailboxes. You’d need to carefully choose the right format and ensure nothing is missed, which can be risky if you’re not tech-savvy.

For a faster and more reliable solution, I recommend using Systool IMAP Backup Tool. It can automatically back up all your Zimbra emails to formats like PST, EML, or MBOX without any data loss, supporting full or selective backup options. This way, you can keep a safe, accessible copy of all your important emails without worrying about manual errors or missing data.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Lost emails from the Local Folders
creator: jobhodas
content:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I have lost all stored folders with my email correspondence from the Local Folders for an unknown reason (I restarted my computer, and they disappeared). I can find some of these emails using the search option, but I cannot see the path of their storage location. I have checked my Profile/Mail/Local Folders, but they are not there. Are they stored on the server? How can I recover these folders?

Thank you very much in advance,

Jasmina
